lines.gurmukhi: jYsy bIrwrwDI imstwn pwn Awn khu Kuvwvq mMgwie mwNgY Awp nhI Kwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Beeraaraadhee Misataan Paan Aan Kahu , Khuvaavat Mangaai Maangai Aap Nahee Khaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as worshipper of brave (in Sikand Puran 52 Bir's Nandi, Bhirangi, Hanuman, Bhairav, etc. are mentioned) asks for sweet, distributes to all but does not eat any himself.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy dRum sPl Plq Pl Kwq nwNih pQk pKyrU qor qor ly jwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Droum Sadhal Dhalat Dhal Khaat Naanhi , Padak Pakhayroo Tor Tor Lay Jaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a tree bears sweet fruits but does not eat them itself. Instead birds, travellers pluck and eat them.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy qO smuMdR iniD pUrn skl ibD hMs mrjIvw hyir kwFq sugwq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Tau Samoundr Nidhi Pooran Sakal Bidha , Hans Marajeevaa Hayri Kaaddhat Sougaat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as ocean is full of all sorts of precious pearls and stones but those who have swan like temperament dives in it and relish them.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy inhkwm swD soBq sMswr ibKY praupkwr hyq suMdr sugwq hY ]564]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Nihakaam Saadh Sobhat Sansaar Bikhai , Paraoupakaar Hayt Soundar Sougaat Hai ?564?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, there are many saints and hermits (who have no self interest and are always ready to do good to others without any gain to themselves) their lives become successful helping others.
